newsitem.title: GERMANY: German bourse postpones Dec 97 Bund futures.
newsitem.headline: German bourse postpones Dec 97 Bund futures.

text.p: The German bourse operating company Deutsche Boerse AG said on Monday it was postponing trade in the December 1997 Bund future, due to start trading tomorrow.

"We have postponed trading in the December 1997 bund future, which was planned to start on Tuesday. The background is a planned change in the contract specifications with a view to extending the duration of the ten year Bund," a Deutsche Boerse spokesman said.
Earlier in the day, the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE) said it was suspending its December 1997 Bund futures contract pending a review.
German bourse postpones Dec 97 Bund futures =2
The spokesman did not say when trade would recommence in the December Bund future.

The Bunds are deliverable against the futures contracts with maturities of between 8.5 and 10 years. The new Bund futures contract, to run from April, announced this morning has a longer maturity period.
